Ini.Preface: ; Configuration file for the SH2 Enhancements module ; Learn more about the settings below at http://enhanced.townofsilenthill.com/SH2/config.htm ; Silent Hill 2: Enhanced Edition is best experienced in a 16:9 aspect ratio!

Feature.name: ScreenMode
Feature.Title: Screen mode
Feature.Description: Sets the screen mode for the game.

Feature.name: WndModeBorder
Feature.Title: Window border (for windowed mode only)
Feature.Description:
Creates a window border for the game. Only works when playing in windowed mode.
Note: The game's windowed resolution must not be close to or exactly the same as your display's width and/or height, otherwise the border will not appear. This is a safety measure to ensure the border doesn't get lost outside of your display area.

Feature.name: DynamicResolution
Feature.Title: Show all resolutions in Options menu
Feature.Description: Detects every resolution your display offers and makes them selectable choices (along with showing their aspect ratios) in the game's Options > Advanced Options menu.

Feature.name: ForceTopMost
Feature.Title: Game window always on top
Feature.Description:
Forces the game window to be above all other windows, inlcuding the Start Menu bar.
Note: Only works when windowed mode is enabled.

Feature.name: FullscreenImages
Feature.Title: Fullscreen image scaling
Feature.Description:
Adds compatibility for the project's Image Enhancement Pack to have its visuals display correctly. Must be enabled if using the Image Enhancement Pack. The scaling works for both the original and enhanced fullscreen images.
Auto: Automatically chooses "fit" or "fill" depending on the aspect ratio for the best presentation. Fit: Displays the fullscreen images without any cropping. Letterboxes or pillarboxes may appear depending on the aspect ratio. Fill: Scales the fullscreen images to fill the display area, removing any letterboxes or pillarboxes, up to a 16:9 aspect ratio.

Feature.name: FullscreenVideos
Feature.Title: FMV scaling
Feature.Description:
Adds compatibility for the project's FMV Enhancement Pack to have its videos display correctly. The scaling works for both the original and enhanced FMVs.
Auto: Automatically chooses "fit" or "fill" depending on the aspect ratio for the best presentation. Fit: Displays the FMVs without any cropping. Letterboxes or pillarboxes may appear depending on the aspect ratio. Fill: Scales FMVs to fill the display area, removing any letterboxes or pillarboxes, up to a 16:9 aspect ratio.

Feature.name: Fix2D
Feature.Title: Prevent fullscreen image stretching
Feature.Description:
Enabling this feature sets the 2D, full screen images to their original aspect ratios, regardless of the aspect ratio used. This will remove stretching on the images when played in widescreen. Disabling this feature stretches the images to fit the screen. This affects all full screen images, such as the main menu, save screens, memo/riddle images, and inventory screen, along with other textures, such as subtitles and the flashlight lens glow.
Note: Disabling this will override and also disable Fullscreen image scaling.

Feature.name: ReduceCutsceneFOV
Feature.Title: Scale cutscene FOV
Feature.Description:
In-engine cutscenes will be zoomed in to match their original 4:3 horizontal compositions when playing in widescreen. This will hide "frozen" character models that have been loaded in, right outside the 4:3 boundaries, ready and waiting to enter the scene.
Note: This feature will zoom up to a 16:9 aspect ratio. It will not zoom past this aspect ratio as too much of the vertical composition would be cropped otherwise. This means that ultra-wide aspect ratios will still see visual anomalies as in-engine cutscenes play out.

Feature.name: SetBlackPillarBoxes
Feature.Title: Restore black pillarboxes
Feature.Description: Primarily fixes issues when viewing the map. This feature forces all dynamically made pillarboxing to be black in color, restores pillarboxing to events which did not have them, and hides map markings behind the pillarboxing.

Feature.name: DisableCutsceneBorders
Feature.Title: Disable cutscene borders
Feature.Description:
Removes in-engine cutscene letterboxing.
Note: It is recommended to enable this if playing in a widescreen aspect ratio and enabling cutscene FOV scaling. Otherwise, the letterboxing may crop off character heads when playing in widescreen.

Feature.name: d3d8to9
Feature.Title: Run the game in DirectX 9 (required to use shaders below)
Feature.Description:
Converts the game from DirectX 8 to DirectX 9, allowing for additional features and fixes to be used.
Note: Must be enabled to use shaders below.

Feature.name: FrontBufferControl
Feature.Title: How should the game capture front buffer data
Feature.Description:
Determines how the game should collect the front buffer data used for fade outs and the pause screen.
Note: DirectX will only work on your primary monitor. DirectX may be required when playing in fullscreen mode on certain older Windows operating systems. Linux only works with DirectX. It is recommended to keep this on "auto" unless you are experiencing visual issues with fade outs or the pause screen.

Feature.name: AdjustColorTemp
Feature.Title: Adjust color temperature
Feature.Description: Adjusts the color temperature of the overall game image to give it a slight cool tint.

Feature.name: RestoreBrightnessSelector
Feature.Title: Restore brightness selector functionality
Feature.Description: Restores the ability to adjust the brightness level in the game's options menu, regardless if playing in windowed or fullscreen mode.

Feature.name: EnableSMAA
Feature.Title: SMAA (anti-aliasing)
Feature.Description:
Enables subpixel morphological anti-aliasing (SMAA).
Note: It is recommended to disable this if using GPU-based anti-aliasing.

Feature.name: CRTShader
Feature.Title: Simulate a CRT Screen
Feature.Description:
Enables shaders that simulate what the game would look like on a CRT television. These shaders look more accurate at lower resolutions. For the best CRT nostalgic experience, play the game in a 4:3 aspect ratio.
Note: It is not recommended to enable this option if you are streaming the game, as the CRT effect may not display correctly to your viewers. It is also not recommended to enable this option if you have a low-end computer system.

Feature.name: EnableTexAddrHack
Feature.Title: Allow for high quality images
Feature.Description: Allows higher quality, upscaled images to be used. Must be enabled if using the project's Image Enhancement Pack.

Feature.name: UseBestGraphics
Feature.Title: Always launch game using best graphics settings
Feature.Description: Enables all advanced graphics settings from the game's Options > Advanced Options menu (complex fog, shadows, lens flare, etc) by default upon each game launch.

Feature.name: EnableSoftShadows
Feature.Title: Restore soft shadows
Feature.Description: Restores shadows and shadow behaviors throughout the game. This includes the use of soft shadows, correct shadow level intensities, accurate shadow fading on flashlight toggles, and the restoration of self shadows (shadows being casted upon dynamic objects such as items and characters).

Feature.name: RestoreSpecialFX
Feature.Title: Restore post-processing effects
Feature.Description: Restores post-processing effects to their original intensities throughout the game. Effects include depth-of-field blur, motion blur, static blur, and pseudo blooms.

Feature.name: SpecularFix
Feature.Title: Restore specularity
Feature.Description: Restores specularity and specular behavior throughout the game. This gives "shininess" to things such as character eyeballs, Red Pyramid Thing's helmet, Maria's skirt, and will make these things shine brighter whenever they're under a light source or when James' flashlight is on.

Feature.name: IncreaseDrawDistance
Feature.Title: Increase draw distance
Feature.Description: Increases the front draw distance in certain areas to hide the environment loading in.

Feature.name: IncreaseBlood
Feature.Title: Increase blood pool sizes
Feature.Description: Increases the blood pool size of dead enemies back to their original amount.

Feature.name: IncreaseNoiseEffectRes
Feature.Title: Adjust noise filter grain
Feature.Description: Adjust the grain size of the noise filter.

Feature.name: PS2StyleNoiseFilter
Feature.Title: Correct noise filter levels
Feature.Description: Restores the levels and opacity of the noise filter back to its original look.

Feature.name: FogFix
Feature.Title: Restore 3D fog levels
Feature.Description: Restores the thickness, size, and amount of fog to its original look.

Feature.name: FogLayerFix
Feature.Title: Restore 2D fog layer
Feature.Description: Fixes an issue on Nvidia graphics cards where the 2D fog layer and the glow around James' flashlight did not render.

Feature.name: FogParameterFix
Feature.Title: Adjust fog-of-war boundaries
Feature.Description: Adjusts the fog-of-war boundaries for specific areas to fix visual errors.

Feature.name: FogSpeedFix
Feature.Title: Natural fog movement
Feature.Description: Adjusts the speed of the fog for slower, more natural movement to match its original behavior.

Feature.name: EnableSFXAddrHack
Feature.Title: Allow for high quality audio
Feature.Description: Allows higher quality sound files to be used. Must be enabled if using the project's Audio Enhancement Pack.

Feature.name: EnableCriWareReimplementation
Feature.Title: Use custom streaming audio engine
Feature.Description: Replaces the game's bugged CRIWARE streaming audio engine with a custom streaming audio engine solution. This fixes the infamous issue where the game's audio would glitch out and play an infinite one second loop, which would inevitably crash the game. This audio issue was the reason why the game would need to be ran on a single processor core prior to this fix. With this fix, the game can now run stable on multiple cores with overall performance improvements (such as less game stutters).

Feature.name: AudioClipDetection
Feature.Title: Audio clip detection
Feature.Description: Detects when any audio event is stopped prematurely and fades out the sound to avoid "popping/clicking" that would otherwise be heard.

Feature.name: SpecificSoundLoopFix
Feature.Title: Fix specific sound looping bugs
Feature.Description: Fixes specific, unique sound looping bugs with the chainsaw and moth attack sounds.

Feature.name: FixInventoryBGM
Feature.Title: Fix incorrect BGM tracks when pulling up menus
Feature.Description: Fixes an issue where the game would play the wrong background music when pulling up menus (Inventory, Memo, Map, Save/Load, etc) under certain circumstances.

Feature.name: SaveGameSoundFix
Feature.Title: Restore "save game" sound through pause menu
Feature.Description: Restores the "save game" sound effect when selecting to save your game through the pause menu.

Feature.name: RestoreSearchCamMovement
Feature.Title: Controller type for search cam movement
Feature.Description:
Restores right joystick functionality for controllers to move the search camera around. Change the setting depending on what type of controller you are using.
Note: If using Xidi (controller support software), set this option to "DirectInput".

Feature.name: DPadMovementFix
Feature.Title: Restore D-pad movement
Feature.Description: Allows the D-pad on DirectInput gamepads to act as movement inputs to control James and navigate menu selections.

Feature.name: GamepadControlsFix
Feature.Title: Assign multiple functions to the same input
Feature.Description: Allows the same controller input to be assigned to multiple game functions through the game's Options > Control Options menu.

Feature.name: Southpaw
Feature.Title: Southpaw
Feature.Description: Swaps left joystick and right joystick functions. Useful for left-handed players.

Feature.name: RestoreVibration
Feature.Title: Restore vibration
Feature.Description: Restores vibration for XInput-based controllers. Make sure to enable vibration through the game's Options menu as well.

Feature.name: PadNumber
Feature.Title: Controller ID to vibrate
Feature.Description: Sets what pad (controller) ID to vibrate. This is typically "0" for the game.

Feature.name: RemoveForceFeedbackFilter
Feature.Title: Remove Force Feedback filter
Feature.Description: Allows non-force feedback controllers to be detected during the game's controller scan. Use this option if a non-force feedback controller is not detected by the Silent Hill 2.

Feature.name: UseCustomFonts
Feature.Title: High resolution text
Feature.Description:
Uses custom font files to produce high-resolution text in-game. Compatible with all preset language options (English, French, German, Italian, and Spanish) in the game.
Note: fontwdata.bin and font000.tga files must be present in "sh2e\font\" for this feature to work.

Feature.name: DisableEnlargedText
Feature.Title: Hide large, floating save menu text
Feature.Description:
Disables the enlarged, floating text while navigating the save/load menu, which may otherwise be distracting.
Note: Requires High Resolution Text to be enabled to work.

Feature.name: MainMenuTitlePerLang
Feature.Title: Use translated main menu text
Feature.Description:
Loads translated main menu text selections for the North American version 1.0 and 1.1 executables.
Note: start01*.tex files must be present in "sh2e\pic\etc\" for this feature to work.

Feature.name: UseCustomExeStr
Feature.Title: Restore all languages in options menu
Feature.Description:
Restores all language options (English, French, German, Italian, and Spanish) as selectable choices in the game's Options menu and creates language-specific pause menu text for the North American executables of the game.
Note: d3d8.res must be present in the game's directory for this feature to work.

Feature.name: UnlockJapLang
Feature.Title: Unlock Japanese language option
Feature.Description:
Restores the ability to select Japanese as a language option through the game's Options menu.
Note: It is recommended to keep this disabled for now, as not all Japanese characters are currently supported.

Feature.name: MainMenuFix
Feature.Title: Fix main menu mouse alignment
Feature.Description: Fixes the mouse hitboxes for the game's main menu selections for the North American version 1.1 executable.

Feature.name: FixAdvancedOptions
Feature.Title: Fix Advanced Options screen
Feature.Description: Fixes numerous text display issues on the game's Options > Advanced Options menu, such as missing and incorrect descriptions when the save confirmation prompt is shown.

Feature.name: FixHangOnEsc
Feature.Title: Disable pause screen during fades
Feature.Description: Prevents the player from bringing up the pause menu during a fade-in, which would otherwise use a wrong screen grab of the game for the pause menu background image.

Feature.name: PauseScreenFix
Feature.Title: Pause screen fix
Feature.Description: Removes flicker when accessing the pause menu and preserves the noise filter and bloom effect when pulling up the pause menu while in Hotel Room 312.

Feature.name: FixSaveBGImage
Feature.Title: Consistent save background images
Feature.Description: Ensures the correct background image for the save/load screen is always shown for the scenario currently being played.

Feature.name: FixMemoFading
Feature.Title: Correctly fade images from Memo list
Feature.Description: Fixes an issue where the top-most layer of memo images would not correctly fade/darken with the rest of the image when viewed through your Memos list.

Feature.name: LockScreenPosition
Feature.Title: Lock Screen Position option
Feature.Description: Disables the Screen Position feature in the game's Options > Advanced Options menu which is no longer needed for modern displays and could otherwise cause visual alignment issues.

Feature.name: LockSpeakerConfig
Feature.Title: Lock Speaker Config option
Feature.Description:
Disables changing the Speaker Configuration feature in the game's Options > Advanced Options menu as, after Windows XP, this change must be done through Windows' Sound Control panel and can no longer be changed within applications (such as this game). If you try to change this through the game's Options menu, it will just revert back to what is being used through Windows' Sound Control panel.
Note: d3d8.res must be present in the game's directory for this feature to work.

Feature.name: CatacombsMeatRoomFix
Feature.Title: Catacomb meat room fix
Feature.Description: Corrects color level values for the Catacomb's meat cold rooms.

Feature.name: FixChainsawSpawn
Feature.Title: Chainsaw only spawns on New Game+
Feature.Description: Prevents the chainsaw from spawning on a first playthrough, which is a developer-intended design choice.

Feature.name: ChangeClosetSpawn
Feature.Title: Change apartment closet spawn
Feature.Description: Places James inside the closet after the Wood Side Apartments Room 307 cutscene ends, to help guide the player's attention to the key inside.

Feature.name: FixAptClockFlashlight
Feature.Title: Fix apartment clock cutscene
Feature.Description: Fixes the flashlight rendering on the apartment grandfather clock at the end of a failed attempt to push it.

Feature.name: ClosetCutsceneFix
Feature.Title: Fix apartment closet cutscene
Feature.Description: Darkens the closet bars and moves the noise grain layer to be on top of the closet bar blur layer during the first-person segment of the apartment closet cutscene. Also adjusts the visuals during another camera cut to better correctly light the scene.

Feature.name: WoodsideRoom205Fix
Feature.Title: Fix enemy spawn in Wood Side Room 205
Feature.Description: Fixes a rare bug where the Mannequin creature in Wood Side Apartments Room 205 may not spawn/behave correctly upon entering the room.

Feature.name: HospitalChaseFix
Feature.Title: Fix hospital chase animation
Feature.Description: Correctly syncs Red Pyramid Thing's attack animation to the rest of the cutscene that plays out during the hospital elevator chase sequence.

Feature.name: FixCreatureVehicleSpawn
Feature.Title: Fix Lying Figures exiting from under vehicles
Feature.Description: Fixes an issue where Lying Figures would exit from underneath vehicles incorrectly.

Feature.name: PistonRoomFix
Feature.Title: Fix piston room cutscene
Feature.Description: Hides a piston behind the wall that would otherwise be seen when Angela opens the door in the Labyrinth during a cutscene.

Feature.name: FixTownWestGateEvent
Feature.Title: Fix town west back alley gate commentary
Feature.Description: Changes James' commentary about the back alley Heaven's Night gate at night to properly reflect the gate's status.

Feature.name: Room312ShadowFix
Feature.Title: Hotel Room 312 shadow fix
Feature.Description: Prevents distracting shadow flickering along the patio glass doors while in Hotel Room 312 and restores the chair's shadow during the cutscene that takes place in this room.

Feature.name: RestoreAlternateStomp
Feature.Title: Restore alternate stomp
Feature.Description: Restores the secondary/alternate stomp animation. When performing a stomp, there is now a 50/50 chance of receiving either stomp animation.

Feature.name: HalogenLightFix
Feature.Title: Restore unlit vertex shader
Feature.Description: Restores luminance for certain environment assets.

Feature.name: HotelWaterFix
Feature.Title: Restore water visuals
Feature.Description: Restores lighting values for the water throughout the game.

Feature.name: RowboatAnimationFix
Feature.Title: Rowboat animation fix
Feature.Description: Fixes an issue with James' character model being placed erratically into the rowboat if you previously entered the rowboat then load an earlier save point to enter the rowboat again.

Feature.name: FixDrawingTextLine
Feature.Title: Thicken hospital diary line
Feature.Description: Thickens the horizontal line in the hospital diary text to make it easier to see at higher rendering resolutions.

Feature.name: GameLoadFix
Feature.Title: Fix save/load issues
Feature.Description: Disables free-saving in select rooms that would cause game issues upon file loading back into the rooms. Addresses quick save bugs that could otherwise soft lock the game.

Feature.name: ImproveStorageSupport
Feature.Title: Fix 2+ TB storage limit
Feature.Description: Allows the game to correctly check free disk space in hard drives larger than 2TB in order to save game files. Changes the displayed unit of measurement for available free space from KB to a scaled, proportionate unit. Example: Changes 99999999+ KB to 108.21 GB.

Feature.name: DisableRedCrossInCutScenes
Feature.Title: Disable low health indicator during cutscenes
Feature.Description: Hides the low health indicator during cutscenes, which would otherwise be distracting as the cutscenes play out.

Feature.name: DisableRedCross
Feature.Title: Disable low health indicator completely
Feature.Description:
Hides the low health indicator completely.
Note: Enabling this option is only recommended if you are using a controller with vibration enabled. Otherwise, you have no way of knowing when you're low on health unless you check the inventory screen.

Feature.name: FixMissingWallChunks
Feature.Title: Fix missing wall chunks
Feature.Description:
Fixes an issue on Nvidia graphics cards where chunks of the wall would disappear if the camera got close to their geometry.
Note: If playing in an ultra-wide aspect ratio, the camera will likely clip through walls. This is a different issue and is unavoidable due to heavy use of tight camera angles throughout this game.

Feature.name: WhiteShaderFix
Feature.Title: White shader fix
Feature.Description: Fixes an issue on Nvidia graphics cards where certain areas would appear white when they should be black.

Feature.name: PS2CameraSpeed
Feature.Title: Fix camera speed
Feature.Description: Increases the camera speed movement back to its intended value and removes "floaty/bouncy" camera behavior that was present in the PC version.

Feature.name: FastTransitions
Feature.Title: Fast transitions
Feature.Description: Increases the speed of all fade out/fade in transitions. Examples include going between rooms, opening/closing the inventory screen, examining memo/riddle images, and saving.

Feature.name: PS2FlashlightBrightness
Feature.Title: Fix flashlight brightness
Feature.Description: Fixes incorrect flashlight brightness levels by reducing its intensity for environments, but keeping enemies and NPCs bright. Also corrects flashlight levels for Wood Side Apartments Room 205 (the flashlight and mannequin room), along with a handful of other specialized rooms.

Feature.name: RoomLightingFix
Feature.Title: Room lighting fix
Feature.Description: Prevents the game from using wrong environmental and fog lighting values in the cemetery, if you load back into this area from a save point. Also corrects lighting levels in various other rooms/areas.

Feature.name: LightingFix
Feature.Title: Lighting fix
Feature.Description: Restores proper environmental settings for the "Maria" ending, and restores lighting conditions for the 3D trees in the "Leave" and "Maria" endings.

Feature.name: LightingTransitionFix
Feature.Title: Lighting transition fix
Feature.Description: Fixes an issue where some light sources would not properly brighten and darken James.

Feature.name: FlashlightFlickerFix
Feature.Title: Fix flashlight flicker
Feature.Description: Fixes a bug that would make James' body flash with light if exiting the pause menu while the flashlight is off.

Feature.name: RemoveEnvironmentFlicker
Feature.Title: Fix cutscene environment flicker
Feature.Description: Removes flicker from environment settings resetting to default values at the end of certain cutscenes.

Feature.name: RemoveEffectsFlicker
Feature.Title: Fix post-processing effect flicker
Feature.Description: Removes flicker that appears at the beginning of any motion blur event.

Feature.name: AutoUpdateModule
Feature.Title: Auto update module
Feature.Description: Upon game launch, the SH2:EE Setup Tool (SH2EEsetup.exe) will check for updates and, if available, will ask the user if they would like to update their files to receive new improvements and features for the project.

Feature.name: UseCustomModFolder
Feature.Title: Use custom "sh2e" folder
Feature.Description: Silent Hill 2: Enhanced Edition will read and use files in the "sh2e" folder, rather than the "data" folder, whenever possible. This allows custom, modified game files to be stored in the "sh2e" folder so as not to replace/overwrite original game files, which are found in the "data" folder. Any game files which have not been modified for the project will still be read from the "data" folder like normal, so you must keep the "data" folder and leave it untouched.

Feature.name: WidescreenFix
Feature.Title: Widescreen Fix
Feature.Description:
Enables the integrated SH2 Widescreen Fixes Pack and sh2proxy module.
Note: If disabled, various other features will also be disabled. This feature should never be disabled.

Feature.name: UsePS2LowResTextures
Feature.Title: Disable "sh2e\pic\" path
Feature.Description:
Disables the "sh2e\pic\" path. This will revert the game to use the original, low resolution full screen images while still using all other files/folders found within the "sh2e" path.
Note: Enabling the use of the custom "sh2e" folder is still required to use all other files/folders found with the "sh2e" path.

Feature.name: CheckForAdminAccess
Feature.Title: Admin privilege checker
Feature.Description:
Removes unneeded Windows Virtual Store files for the game and asks for adminstrator access if the game is located in an admin-protected directory. Adminstrator access is required if the game is located within an admin-protected directory in order to save game progress.
Note:It is recommended to store the game in a local user directory (not an admin-protected directory) as a general rule.

Feature.name: CheckCompatibilityMode
Feature.Title: Compatibility mode checker
Feature.Description: Checks if unsupported Windows compatibility options are enabled for the game's executable and disables them.

Feature.name: CreateLocalFix
Feature.Title: Create "local.fix" file on game launch
Feature.Description: Creates a local.fix file in the game's directory (if it does not already exist) to allow GPU-based anti-aliasing support for the game.

Feature.name: DisableSafeMode
Feature.Title: Disable crash low visual mode
Feature.Description: Prevents the game from overriding and using the lowest visual settings upon relaunch if the game previously crashed.

Feature.name: DisableScreenSaver
Feature.Title: Disable screen saver
Feature.Description: Disables the screensaver while the game is running.

Feature.name: DisableHighDPIScaling
Feature.Title: Disable Windows high DPI scaling
Feature.Description: Disables Windows' high DPI scaling for the game to prevent certain display issues, such as a "burnt-in" image from appearing during fade transitions.

Feature.name: NoCDPatch
Feature.Title: No CD patch
Feature.Description: Removes the CD check on some versions of the game. Not guaranteed to work on all executables.

Feature.name: SteamCrashFix
Feature.Title: Steam crash fix
Feature.Description: Prevents a crash when Steam controller configuration is used or when going to the game's options menu while using certain types of gamepads.

Feature.name: DisableGameUX
Feature.Title: Disable Windows GameUX.dll
Feature.Description: Disables Microsoft Game Explorer (GameUX.dll) to prevent the game hanging on launch and rundll32.exe high CPU usage.

Feature.name: FixGPUAntiAliasing
Feature.Title: Fix GPU anti-aliasing
Feature.Description: Fixes issues for Nvidia graphics cards, such as missing/incorrect shadows, when force-enabling anti-aliasing through of your GPU's control panel.

Feature.name: SingleCoreAffinityLegacy
Feature.Title: Single core affinity
Feature.Description:
Limits the game to run on one CPU core. Note that it is no longer necessary to run the game on a single core if enabling the project's custom streaming audio engine.
Note: If the value is set to a number that is greater than the available cores on your computer, it will default to using the first core (CPU 0).

Feature.name: LoadPlugins
Feature.Title: Load plugins
Feature.Description: Loads ASI plugins.

Feature.name: LoadFromScriptsOnly
Feature.Title: Load from "scripts" folder
Feature.Description: Loads ASI plugins only from the "scripts" and "plugins" folders.

Feature.name: LoadD3d8FromScriptsFolder
Feature.Title: Load d3d8.dll from "scripts" folder
Feature.Description:
Loads d3d8.dll from the "scripts" and "plugins" folders.
Requires disabling the game running in DirectX 9 to work.
